New Records: The Cavaliers became the first team since Golden State in 2015-16 to win 13 straight to start a season.
The Cavaliers tied Cleveland’s franchise record of 13 straight wins set three previous times — in 2009, 2010 and 2017 — all with LeBron James.
Key Match Events: Donovan Mitchell had 23 points, 14 rebounds, and nine assists in the Cavaliers' 114-106 win over Philadelphia.
Rookie first-round pick Jared McCain scored a career-high 34 points and had Philadelphia within three with just over three minutes to play.
Donovan Mitchell closed the game with 11 points in the final three minutes and just missing his first career triple-double.
Pre-Game Insights: Cleveland first-year coach Kenny Atkinson said that the team's winning streak is a burden and that the Philadelphia Sixers were thinking 'We could end the streak.'
Post-Match Reflections: Cleveland's star forward Donovan Mitchell said that they are 'the hunted, but it's also November' and that they need to'relax' and not get too high or too low.

Guard Darius Garland said that the team has a lot of work to do and that they need to clean up some things, but it's a good balance that they have right now because they know that they can get a lot better, even though they're still undefeated.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers are just the sixth team in NBA/BAA history to start 13-0.
Four of the previous five teams went on to reach the championship round.
The team's next litmus test will be a Tuesday night game at defending NBA champion Boston.
Others: The Cavaliers' success has been based on ball movement and scoring, with six Cleveland players averaging double figures in scoring.
Cleveland is carrying a big burden with its winning streak, and the Philadelphia Sixers were motivated to end it.
